Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the complimentary breakfast offer!”
Reviews.Author: Lynher
Reviews.Content: My and wife and I stayed at Cabrillo Suites & Inn recently on a visit to San Diego. We drove from Los Angeles stopping enroute at La Holla briefly before proceeding to Point Loma. I booked the above hotel after reading guest reviews and the proximity to the Cabrillo Monument. The hotel was easy to find been on the main Rosecrans Street, with fre underground parking, albeit a bit cramped There was lift to access the rooms. The room we had was adequate, clean and tidy although a bit dated and tired. There was a functioning AC The bathroom was well maintained and the towels were clean and fresh. The neighbourhood had plenty of eating places catering to variety of cuisines. We tried a Thai restaurant-Thai House and was very impressed with the service and quality of the delicious food. The in-house complimentary breakfast was a joke-it was almost non-existent consisting of very weak coffee and some limp, listless apology of a strudel. The owner sensing our disappointment did recommend a bakery next door which served excellent breakfast. We visited Point Loma which was 4 miles drive from the hotel. The marina was walking distance. We would stay here again as it is value for money for an overnight stay but would skip the breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: I just spent 5 weeks in this small hotel, ideally located in San Diego. Originally I checked-in for 3 days but the High Level of Service from Dan the owner, won me over and I cancelled my other reservation to spend my entire stay at Cabrillo Inn. It is a comfy "unpretentious" small hotel run by a family who understand Customer Service and what it lacks in amenities from larger hotels is more than made up by good service and convenience. There is Off Street parking and a magnificent view of the San Diego skyline from the 4th floor landing. Nearby Starbucks and small eateries are all nearby. I will definetely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good, if you aren't look for luxury”
Reviews.Author: FranciscoBHMGBRAZIL
Reviews.Content: Very well located, good price, clean and old hotel. Don't expect for a great hotel, but a plain one.

Reviews.Title: “Not ever”
Reviews.Author: Lewis M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not at all how the pictures and describtion showed it. There was no A/C in the room. The furniture looked like a few pieces of plywood that were nailed together. I am not sure where the kitchenette was, but it was not in the room. I was afraid that I would be on an episode of Cops. I spent nights in dirty foxholes in the desert and would prefer to spend a night in them over this hotel. Great place for an 1 hour encounter

Reviews.Title: “Geeat for the Money”
Reviews.Author: cruisingal54
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before we flew out on Thursday. I got a tremendous AAA rate that I couldn't refuse. For our needs it was great. The AC unit is really weird and threw heat. We opened the door and ran the ceiling fan on high for about a half hour. Cooled the room right down and we were good. Looked like the room had just been renovated on some levels,i.e., bathroom and that was nice. The owner is a very nice man . He even printed out our airline tickets for us.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par”
Reviews.Author: Momma6Calgary
Reviews.Content: Using trip advisor recommendations, we stayed here one night on our way to Ensenada Mexico. Very dingy front lobby area, and our room was pretty run down. There was a tile loose in the bathroom, the furnishings all outdated and shabby. Lots of traffic noise from the street, too. Breakfast is non existent - a coffee urn and some dried out pastry. On the plus side, the bed was comfortable. However, we stayed at the Best Western Lamplighter on the way home, and for only an extra $10 - and there were 4 of us, not 2! - we had a much nicer room, very modern, and a super breakfast. Would never recommend the Cabrillo or stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: BHP1
Reviews.Content: Our last visit to Point Loma was two years ago when we stayed at the Dolphin. This time we needed a place that was pet friendly so we thought we would try the Cabrillo. The hotel is an odd building from an architectural perspective. The basement is the indoor parking area. The office is on the first floor but there are no rooms there. The second floor is numbered as the third and the third floor is numbered as the fourth floor. The rooms all face toward the inside of the hotel which is actually hollow with a void that opens to the sky on the two floors with rooms. The rooms on the south side of the hotel have views out onto south Point Loma whereas the rooms on the north side have views of the void.The front of the building opens out onto busy Rosecrans St. with a bit of a view of the harbour. This is the smoking area but also makes a sort of private deck, nice if its sunny and warm. The continental breakfast is a bit skimpy, coffee and strudel. Fortunately, this area of Point Loma is very visitor friendly and if you so desire all sorts of cuisine is within easy walking distance, as are banks, laundromat, general store, pharmacy, post office, liquor stores etc. Our room was on the south side on the fourth floor and was therefore a bit noisy with the sliding door open, but my wife's snoring largely drowned it out. Our room was a bit crowded as there was an extra single bed in there that we didn't need, however the fridge and microwave worked fine. The TV was a bit small but compensated by having a good selection of channels and the wifi also worked well. We originally booked for 3 nights and even took an extra night and in hindsight we should have stayed 5 nights or even longer. Overall, we found the Cabrillo to be good value, it's well located, clean and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Really pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Planehazza
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night after flying from the UK to San Diego. Great service and pleasant clean rooms. I looking for a room later on next week and I'm hoping to return here.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, clean, excellent location...”
Reviews.Author: msbrwnn
Reviews.Content: Very friendly, clean, excellent location. Not sure if he was owner but guy at front desk made us feel at home. Let us park my father in laws red Corvette in special place. Excellent customer service. Staying longer next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tiny, but hard to sleep because it was loud”
Reviews.Author: starshine514
Reviews.Content: The room was basically clean (with the exception of shower curtain and bathtub drain plug). It was very tiny (barely enough room for the two beds), but had a mini-fridge and microwave (but no alarm clock). My biggest complaint was the in-room A/C unit. You had to keep the door (to the non-existent balcony) open in order for it not to generate more heat than cold (it wasn't vented, so this was the only way to vent it). So, I heard street noise, all night, while trying to sleep there (including a early morning garbage truck and all-hours sirens). Did not get a good night's sleep here, and would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Had a Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: gusto777
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Cabrillo Inn Point Loma for 2 nights over the 4th of July weekend. We found this hotel to be a basic older "no frills" property but clean and comfortable and it certainly met our needs while visiting San Diego. Hosts Dan and Joy were very friendly and accommodating and made us feel at home. The location is excellent !! We would stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to anyone seeking basic lodging while in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: don07
Reviews.Content: Joy and Dan are excellent hosts. We have been staying here for several years and find them to be the friendliest and most accommodating people. Excellent location close to the bay, shopping, restaurants, banks, convenience stores. Quaint hotel, clean rooms, super rates. friendly, helpful staff. Wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Almost like your home!”
Reviews.Author: WHOI
Reviews.Content: Clean, with all of the things needed to make the stay comfortable: Fridge, microwave, Cable TV/HBO, AC, roomy, great location (in Point Loma) with many restaurants located nearby, laundramat (1 block away), General store (next door), and a great open inner area for hanging around with friends. Owners Dan & Joy are wonderful to deal with, and go out of their way to assist with any needs you may have.

Reviews.Title: “For Point Loma location, this is the place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Loma77
Reviews.Content: Every week for over twelve years Dan and Joy Patel have made me feel at home at their Cabrillo Inn with clean rooms, standing reservations, and sincere friendliness. Its a great location to Point Loma and all of San Diego City and County. The Inn provided a quite, good nights rest needed to conduct business and work with the U.S. Navy laboratories on Point Loma. Over the years, many improvements have been made to bring the inn up to what I consider a very high quality place to stay at reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent .....”
Reviews.Author: yogimonti
Reviews.Content: Wow. Very Good place to stay with the harbor view . very good atmosphere. Lots of places to go around. Drug store, USPS, Fast food Places at the walking distance. Safe area. Internet is working fine. quite place to stay longer. Public transport is easily available. Lots of banks around so no need to worry.

Reviews.Title: “In a pinch it's a cinch”
Reviews.Author: krammany
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were stranded after having missed our flight at the San Diego Airport. We called several places, but we found a very reasonable rate at the Cabrillo Motor Lodge. We placed our belongings and walked a mere 4 or 5 blocks in a slight drizzle down to the water's edge to share a romantic stroll. Dan the manager gave us some directions to many of the local eateries within walking distance. We shared a romantic moment out. The bed was very comfortable-one of the best for a 1 star hotel. I feel like the service was accommodating, and the room was clean, quaint, and sensible. I would return here and stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: Cabrillo Inn & Suites Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 1150 Rosecrans Street, San Diego, CA CA 92106
